result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Anthony Miller

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel Anthony Miller appeared by video.  Attorney Katherine Graber appeared by video for Daniel Anthony Miller.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Attorney Graber informs court that she was recently appointed. and needs additional time to review with client.  Case adjourned for a status conference date to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 10-11-22
Received and Filed: Pretrial Violation Report 10-10-2022
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk
Notice of Completion of Representation.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Daniel Anthony Miller appeared by video.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms in court for Daniel Anthony Miller.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State, but needs additional time to review with client. Court adjourns matter for a Status Conference to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 9-9-22

Defendant Daniel Anthony Miller in court by video with Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons who appears in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa Officer D. Dosedla.  Court took judicial notice of 12CF5606. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Supervision Report 07-22-2022
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Daniel Anthony Miller in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests this matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

22RM029392  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff
06/09/2022
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD
Court orders previous conditions to remain in full force and effect.

Defendant Daniel Anthony Miller in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Daniel Anthony Miller in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared on behalf of Jon Josephsen for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Return on Warrant. Arguments heard as to bail. Court sets bail at $500.00 with other conditions. Case adjourned to Prelim Court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Bench Warrant Cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 06/06/2022. Original bench warrant scanned. Case is adjourned for Return of Bench Warrant in Branch 16 on 06/09/2022 at 08:30 am. Notice is given to Public Defender's Office and District Attorney.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($2,000.00 signature bond) LW
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Discharge Report 3-29-2022
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

10:08 AM Defendant Daniel Anthony Miller not in court.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Daniel Anthony Miller in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Daniel Anthony Miller in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daniel Anthony Miller appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
